intro: Puccinellia longior, commonly known as slender glassworts, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Plantaginaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in saline or coastal environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are often succulent, which helps it retain moisture in arid or salty soils. Puccinellia longior plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for various small organisms.
